# start()

**Instance Method**

Starts the animation represented by the receiver.

## Declaration

```swift
func start()
```

## Discussion

A strong reference to the animation is maintained until the end of the animation or until its [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimation/stop()] method is called. If the blocking mode is [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimation/BlockingMode/blocking], this method returns after the animation has completed or the delegate sends it [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimation/stop()]. If the receiver has a progress of `1.0`, it starts again at `0.0`.

## Related Documentation

- **start(when:reachesProgress:)**: Starts running the animation represented by the receiver when another animation reaches a specific progress mark.

## Controlling and Monitoring an Animation

- **stop()**: Stops the animation represented by the receiver.
- **isAnimating**: A Boolean value indicating whether the animation is in progress.
- **currentProgress**: The current progress of the animation.
- **currentValue**: The current value of the animation effect, based on the current progress
